definitions.definition: a longer route that you take in order to avoid a problem or to visit a place

examples.text: We had to make a detour around the flooded fields.
It's well worth making a detour to see the village.
The monument is well worth a detour.
The ship made a detour to the south.
Trucks now face a five-mile detour around the bridge.
We had to make a lengthy detour through the backstreets.

definitions.definition: a road or route that is used when the usual one is closed

wordOrigin: mid 18th cent. (as a noun): from French détour ‘change of direction’, from détourner ‘turn away’.
